tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE workshops (
    workshop_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    workshop_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    workshop_date DATE,
    workshop_location VARCHAR(100),
    workshop_instructor VARCHAR(100)
);

CREATE TABLE seminar_guest_lectures (
  event_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  event_name VARCHAR(255),
  event_type VARCHAR(50),
  event_date DATE,
  event_location VARCHAR(255)
);

CREATE TABLE workshops (
    workshop_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    workshop_name VARCHAR(255),
    workshop_date DATE,
    workshop_time TIME,
    workshop_location VARCHAR(255)
);

CREATE TABLE seminars (
    seminar_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    seminar_topic VARCHAR(255),
    seminar_date DATE,
    seminar_speaker VARCHAR(255),
    seminar_location VARCHAR(255)
);

CREATE TABLE guest_lectures (
    lecture_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    lecture_topic VARCHAR(255),
    lecture_date DATE,
    lecturer_name VARCHAR(255),
    lecture_location VARCHAR(255)
);

CREATE TABLE Workshops (
  workshop_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  workshop_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  workshop_date DATE,
  workshop_location VARCHAR(255),
  workshop_instructor VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE Seminars (
  seminar_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  seminar_title VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  seminar_date DATE,
  seminar_location VARCHAR(255),
  seminar_host VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE music_workshops (
    workshop_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    workshop_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    workshop_date DATE,
    workshop_duration INTERVAL,
    workshop_location VARCHAR(100)
);

CREATE TABLE seminars (
    seminar_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    seminar_topic VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    seminar_type VARCHAR(50),
    seminar_date DATE,
    seminar_duration INTERVAL
);

CREATE TABLE guest_lectures (
    lecture_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    speaker_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    lecture_topic VARCHAR(100),
    lecture_date DATE,
    lecture_duration INTERVAL
);
